Fix name= when ticket validation fails

When submitting an invalid new ticket form, no associated user is initialized and therefore the attempt to set "name" kaboomed.

Add controller, action, user classes to body

To restyle different parts of the application with a custom stylesheet, it's necessary to have elements to root your custom styles to.

This commit adds the two classes to the body tag:
* <controller_name>-<action_name> (e.g. "tickets-new")
* "user-signed-in" if a use has previously authenticated himself

Say, you want to include the public new tickets form into another website by use of an iframe, you can match the styling by rooting your custom styles to "body.tickets-new:not(.user-signed-in)".

Merge pull request #448 from svoop/ask_for_name

Optionally ask for name on new ticket forms

Support for custom CSS/JS by app setting or tenant

Until now, it was only possible to configure a custom CSS on the tenant.

For some customizing (e.g. renaming submit button text on standalone new ticket view), custom JS is necessary. However, custom JS may open the door to malicious JS injection after getting illegitimate access to any agent's account. Time for some extra security.

There are four new application settings now:

enable_custom_stylesheet (default: true)
Main switch for custom stylesheets.

enable_custom_javascript (default: false)
Main switch for custom javascript.

custom_stylesheet_url (default: nil)
Overrides the URL set on the tenant. This URL will be showed on the settings form as a disabled input.

custom_javascript_url (default: nil)
Overrides the URL set on the tenant. This URLwill be showed on the settings form as a disabled input.

Optionally ask for name on new ticket forms

For new tickets created by email and in order to keep the new tickets forms short, setting the user name to what's in front of the email-@ is very nice.

However, for those who heavily rely on new ticket forms and would like to have the real user names, this new tenant setting will come in handy:

Tick the checkbox next to "ask for name on new ticket forms" and users may enter their real name when submitting a new ticket by use of the forms.
Add subtitle to explain signature input
Complete localization code of email template views
Fix wrong margin on trashed tickets view

Use I18n.available_locales to build @locales options

This is more "the Rails way (tm)" and therefore less magic for new developers, but also comes with a bonus advantage: It's possible to check in new locale files or keep no longer maintained existing ones while excluding them from the language dropdowns.
Complete localization code of email template views

Add time_ago_as_phrase helper

Some languages postfix (en: "5 minutes ago") while others prefix (fr: "il y a 5 minutes").

Add rake task "locales:completeness"

Diffs the locale keys of every available locale against the default locale to see which ones are missing or superfluous. See README for more.

Localize and HTMLize all notification mails

* Localize some previously en only notificaton mails
* HTMLize some text only notification mails
* Fix related translation mistakes in fr-FR, fr-CA and de
* DRY notification mails

Add mailer previews

You must run "rake test" at least once in order to populate the test db with fixtures before accessing the mailer previews on "/rails/mailers".

To only show a specific locale, set the environment variable MAILER_PREVIEW_LOCALE accordingly.

Rename canned response to canned reply

...and fix a bug which caused a test to go red.

Refactor incoming mail hook for Mailgun support

In order to implement other hooks e.g. for Mandrill:
* Add a private method TicketsController#mandrill which returns the raw incoming message (compatible to the output of the post-mail script).
* Add "mandrill" to the list of hooks in TicketsController#MAIL_HOOKS.
* Add "mandrill" to the "acceptable mail hooks" test in TicketsControllerTest.

Basic implementation of canned responses

For a "canned response" dropdown to appear when replying on a ticket, simply create at least one email template of the kind "canned response" beforehand.

Ignore misc deploy only files

To facilitate installing and updating Brimir from Git:

* "/log" - ignore everything in the log dir including subdirs with archived/gzipped logs created by logrotate
* "public/assets" - ignore precompiled assets
* "vendor/bundle" - ignore deployment bundle

replies controller test: actually check the `smtp-envelope-to` rather than the `to` field.

After
https://github.com/fiedl/brimir/commit/fb3025e0e0a53dc5edf1a939e8d863400
6bdac48, all clients are listed in the `to` fields. Agents are not in

Moving the list of notified users into a partial. Distinguish agents.

moving reply notification delivery into `Reply#notify_users`.

No actual change of behaviour.

This is just to remove some redundancy and make the code more readable.

notification mailer: Include other clients in the `To` email field.

To allow clients to choose to which other clients they would like to
reply, include other clients in the `To` email field.

Agents are not included in the `To` email field to prevent their
personal email addresses from becoming public.

This change is discussed in https://github.com/ivaldi/brimir/issues/259.

Moving `Reply#set_default_notifications!` into concern

… in order to increase readability when working on reply notifications.

Fix header being off center on mobile

Foundation sets the width to 75%, but doesn't center the block so it appears off center on mobile. By forcing the block to 100% it effectively centers the text inside the navbar, which is 100% the width of the viewport.

adding feature: filter by user

Clicking on a user’s email address in `tickets#index` or `tickets#show`
leads to `tickets#index` where all tickets by that user are shown.

This view shows tickets in all states, i.e. also closed tickets, in
order to provide a quick way to look up all tickets by a certain user.

When in this filtered mode, a filter bar is shown in tickets#index.
Clicking on the filter entry, removes the filter.
